conditions.weatherComment: Musselburgh is frost and snow free as we go into Thursday evening and the temperature reached +5.2 degrees during the day.  We have had 4 mm rain today.  Tonight is forecast to be breezy and mostly cloudy but the cloud cover is not completely reliable.  Four weather models give full cloud cover and temperatures going no lower than +2 but one model has cloud clearing and temperatures dipping below zero during the night.  Friday is mostly dry with a low (30%) chance of an isolated light shower (1 mm) and temperatures similar to today at +4/5 degrees.

conditions.weatherComment: Temperatures have stayed above zero overnight and will rise to +4 today.  Snow this morning (40% chance) will turn to rain this afternoon producing 4-7 mm of precipitation.  Thursday night (New Year's Eve) is forecast to be breezy and mostly cloudy but the cloud cover is not completely reliable.  If/when it breaks there is a risk that temperatures will drop below zero and giving some frost in the ground.  The Met Office however are forecasting that temperatures will remain above zero throughout the night.  Friday is mostly dry with a low (30%) chance of an isolated light shower and +4 degrees.

conditions.weatherComment: 6 mm rain/snow past 24 hours and temps have dipped to -1.4 degrees this morning.  Wednesday will to be dry and cold +2.  Temperatures will fall to - 2 tonight but there is rain/snow moving in with possible accumulations of 1-5 mm.  Thursday will be cloudy and breezy and possible accumulations of rain/snow will be 2-7 mm with temperatures rising to +4.  Rain will help to move any frost.  Thursday night into Friday sees a wide range of temperatures from -2 to +2 depending on the amount of cloud cover.  There is a risk of frost but the more reliable forecasts keep temperatures above zero.  Friday is forecast to be mostly dry and + 2 to 4 degrees.

Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road - there is a testing station to the left of the main entrance. The Marriott Hotel entrance & car park will be used for Owners only. The second testing station is located in the horse box car park, and is to be used for stable staff arriving in horse boxes only. Spectators & owners are located in the Amber Zone - crossing between zones is not permitted. Trainers temporary viewing is the Upper Eclipse (head on stand) - access only from the bottom of the horse walk (sign posted from there). COVID TIER 2.

Testing Stations for Horseboxes and Trainers/Jockeys are all located within the Main Car Park, with access via the Horsebox Gate off Esher High Street. 

Free hot food for stable staff is available via voucher within the Sandown Lodge Staff Canteen. Free tea, coffee and water available.

Sandown Park Racecourse is in Tier 4, therefore it is with regret that from January 1st Owners will be unable to attend.

conditions.groundComment: After a sharp overnight frost there is a surface crust to the ground at present.
conditions.weatherComment:
Dry since 17mm rain last weekend.
Temperature dropped to -3 on Wednesday night, currently 0. Cold and dry day expected Thursday, max 3 degrees. -1 minimum forecast for Thursday night and forecast to stay above freezing Friday night. Saturday maximum 4/5 degrees.
conditions.other: Frost covers deployed in all shaded areas.
conditions.stablingComment: Overnight stabling and accommodation is available. Bookings to Stable Manager Dominic.toole@thejockeyclub.co.uk (07961 387967)
conditions.bookingComment:
Testing Stations for Horseboxes and Trainers/Jockeys are all located within the Main Car Park, with access via the Horsebox Gate off Esher High Street. 

Free hot food for stable staff is available via voucher within the Sandown Lodge Staff Canteen. Free tea, coffee and water available.

Colour bag drop off and saddle collection is located outside the front of the Weighing Room.



Sandown Park Racecourse is in Tier 4, therefore it is with regret that from January 1st Owners will be unable to attend.

conditions.other:
Free breakfast bacon rolls or free hot lunch available for everyone accredited in green zone in the Long Bar. Food vouchers for stable staff and trainers to be got from stable manager. Free, fresh coffees, teas and hot drinks available all day from Jojo's coffee stall outside the weighing room. 
I hope you all had a very Happy Christmas and we all look forward to seeing you on 4th Jan. Happy New Year and if you have any questions please give me a buzz on 07767 802206. Stay save, sane and happy. David Hunter

conditions.weatherComment: 3 mm rain Fri night. Forecast: Dry Sat with wintry showers Sat night/Sun giving between 1 - 5 mm. Cold but not freezing and Mon mainly dry. Frost or snow not currently forecast as a potential problem.
conditions.other:
Free breakfast bacon rolls or free hot lunch available for everyone accredited in green zone in the Long Bar. Food vouchers for stable staff and trainers to be got from stable manager. Free, fresh coffees, teas and hot drinks available all day from Jojo's coffee stall outside the weighing room. 
I hope you all had a very Happy Christmas and we all look forward to seeing you on 4th Jan. Happy New Year and if you have any questions please give me a buzz on 07767 802206. Stay save, sane and happy. David Hunter
conditions.bookingComment: Horses can be booked in to stay overnight but trainers will need to arrange their own accommodation locally with hotels or B&B.

conditions.weatherComment: Currently some sleet and showers. Remaining wet and breezy for most of the morning and afternoon. Max temperatures, just 2C.
conditions.other:
TRAINERS: please note to reduce numbers in the green zone, there will be no hot meal provided for breakfast (tea & coffee available), only for lunch (2 hours before the first race until the penultimate race) - available in the Brasserie.
Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Note: Apologies the big screen is currently not working, ADI are repairing it on Wednesday 6th January. COVID TIER 4.

data.going: ABANDONED - Frost (Day Before)
data.weather: Broken Showers. 6 mm of rain in the past 24 hours and +1 degrees overnight (no frost). Wintery showers will continue this morning (1-2 mm) and then it will turn drier and sunnier this afternoon. It will quickly turn frosty tonight under clear skies (-2 degrees) but cloud cover will develop through the night and temperatures will rise to about zero/+1.  Thursday will start cloudy with a risk of rain/snow (1-3 mm) and temperatures will recover slowly to +3 degrees.  There is a risk of frozen ground on Thursday morning, which depends on the timing of cloud cover developing during the night to lift temperatures above zero. Precautionary Inspection 8 am on Thursday.
data.other: Musselburgh in Scotland Level 4.  There is no food available at the Premier Inn but there are a variety of take-aways in Musselburgh, which are open.  Breakfast will be served in the Racecourse Bistro from 7.30 am on raceday.

conditions.weatherComment: The temperature Wednesday night dropped to -3c.  Overnignight fog will be slow to clear with the odd sunny spell possible later with a light SW wind and a high of 1c.
conditions.other:
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 4 1/2" after racing on Wednesday and reinstated with a gallop master finish prior to racing.  No problems are anticipated.
Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race NO ACCESS TO RACECOURSE WILL BE AVAILABLE UNTIL PASSING THROUGH THIS. PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID. Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival. Hot meals will be provided for attendees & separately for Jockeys.

data.weather: 3mm rain over the weekend. -4.2 overnight, course currently frozen in places. Currently -3.9 at 08.00, daytime temps set to remain low at only +2, before another lighter frost this evening. Clouding over early hours of tomorrow morning, before wintry showers push in from lunchtime.
data.other: Please remember photo ID and face coverings. Please familiarise yourselves with BHA resumption of racing plan. Temporary male changing room on 1st/2nd floors of main building. Female Jockeys in Weighing Room building. Colour drop off/collection at entrance of temporary facility. Taunton is in a Tier 4 Region

conditions.weatherComment:
Currently some sleet.
Forecast: heavy rain pushing through for the morning, stopping mid afternoon.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen). COVID TIER 4.

Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. The Marriott Hotel entrance & car park will be used for Owners only. Owners are located in the Amber Zone and we offer a maximum of 4 owners badges per runner, with no restriction on arrival/ departure time and take away food, tea & coffee available from the Brasserie. Crossing between zones is not permitted. COVID TIER 3.
conditions.bookingComment: For overnight accommodation please contact Stephanie Wethered (Trainee Clerk & Racing Executive) on swethered@lingfieldpark.co.uk or 07977 435569 following declarations.

conditions.rails:
Wood bend is out 6yds. Stands Bend is out 8yds Hurdle and 12yds Chase.
Due to ground conditions the final flight in the home straight will be set out from the inner rail.
conditions.weatherComment:
3mm of rain Monday. 3mm Tuesday. 24mm Thursday.
7mm of rain so far Saturday morning.
Rain clearing by midday on a cold and blustery day.
conditions.other:
The screening stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. All vehicles will enter via the main public car park off Legsby road to be screened and accredited. Please remember to bring your photo ID. Key information: 
- A colours bag drop-off/collection point is located to the side of the Red Rum bar. 
- Complimentary food for stable staff and trainers will be available from the Red Rum bar. Please note a voucher system will be in place, additional purchases will be available by card payment only.
conditions.inspectionComment: The track is currently raceable however due to the latest forecast and the potential for wintry showers a precautionary inspection will be held at 08:00 on raceday, albeit we remain optimistic.

conditions.other:
Testing stations will be open at 11.40 a.m.  NO ACCESS TO RACECOURSE WILL BE AVAILABLE UNTIL PASSING THROUGH THIS. PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID. Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival. Hot meals will be provided for attendees & separately for Jockeys.
TRACK MAINTENANCE. The track will be harrowed to a depth 4" prior to racing and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish

data.going: ABANDONED - Waterlogged (Day of Racing) Water logged in places (GoingStick:6.0 on 18-01-2021 at 12:15)
data.weather: Sunny. 13 mm rain overnight by 5.30 am on Tues and still raining. Having spoken to forecaster there is still 6-8 mm of rain to come this morning before clearing at about midday. Concerns that by then parts of course will be flooded properly and emergency vehicles would struggle to get to all parts of the course. . Sadly, I have had to make the difficult decision to abandon racing today.
data.other: A complimentary hot lunch will be available for all green zone staff in the Long Bar and also free tea and coffee and hot drinks from Jojo's coffee cart next to weighing room. Lunch vouches to be collected from stable manager. Stay safe, happy, well and sane and we all look froward to seeing you with us next Tuesday. Any questions then please give me a buzz on 07767 802206. David Hunter

conditions.weatherComment:
Currently 1 inch of wet snow turning to rain (10mm so far in rain gauge).
Thurs 14th: Wet! Could see 16mm of rain/sleet Temps 1/2c all day.
Fri 15th: -2c due with daytime temps up to 1c. Overcast.
Sat 16th: Damp am 2-3mm Temps between 4/6c. Winds in south.
Sun 17th: Stiff winds in west 5/6c dry
Mon 18th: Stiff winds in west. 3/4c 
Tues 19th: -2c overnight with daytime temps around 2c. Rain returning overnight.
Weds 20th: milder but more rain heavy rain forecast.

data.cotcInspectionText: We will be holding a precautionary inspection at 7.30am Thursday. In case we have more rain than forecasted. Am confident we will be fine. Will announce decision earlier if possible.
data.weatherText: Partly Cloudy. We have had 35mm of rain in the last 24hrs. Due the odd shower up till 11am. Then dry. Cooler+6C.
data.goingText: Heavy, Soft (in places) PASSED INSPECTION. WE RACE.BHA SITE NOT WORKING RE INSPECTION PENDING BUT HAS PASSED . (GoingStick:4.9 on 21-01-2021 at 09:30) . INSPECTION PASSED. WE ARE FIT TO RACE. WE MAY BYPASS THE HURDLE BY THE STABLES BUT WILL MONITOR.
data.inspectionsText: (Status: Passed) Precautionary Inspection to be held on Thursday 21-01-2021 at 07:30 We will be holding a precautionary inspection at 7.30am Thursday. In case we have more rain than forecasted. Am confident we will be fine. Will announce decision earlier if possible.
data.railText: Ludlow Bend out 10m. Add to distances. Race1+35yds, Race2+70yds, Race3+60yds, Race4+70yds, Race5+60yds, Race6+60yds, Race7+35yds. WE HAVE TAKEN OUT THE HURDLE BY THE RACECOURSE STABLES DUE TO SOME SURFACE WATER.

conditions.rails: The bottom bend is split for the hurdle and steeplechase races.  The Hurdle course is on the inner and the steeplechase course is on the outer + 6 yards
conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight.  A dry and breezy day max temperatures + 4 degrees.
conditions.other: Musselburgh is in Scotland Level 4.  There is no food available at the Premier Inn but a selection of good takeaway outlets are open in Musselburgh and the Racecourse will provide breakfast from 7.30am in the Bistro on raceday.
conditions.inspectionComment: There is currently a light covering of snow on the track and a risk of frost on Thursday night.

conditions.rails: The bottom bend is split for the hurdle and steeplechase races.  The Hurdle course is on the inner and the steeplechase course is on the outer + 6 yards
conditions.weatherComment: 20 mm rain/snow overnight (38 mm last 48 hours).  Becoming drier and breezier on Thursday but still the risk of wintry showers 2-5 mm during the day.  For this evening and overnight, there will be a mix of cloud and clear breaks.  There may be enough cloud and wind to keep temperatures above zero/freezing but there remains a risk of some frost on Friday morning.  Friday will be dry and cold +3 degrees. Inspection for frost 8 am on Friday.
conditions.other: Musselburgh is in Scotland Level 4.  There is no food available at the Premier Inn but a selection of good takeaway outlets are open in Musselburgh and the Racecourse will provide breakfast from 7.30am in the Bistro on raceday.
conditions.stablingComment: To book stabling email musselburghstables@gmail.com
conditions.bookingComment: To book accommodation email musselburghstables@gmail.com or telephone Harriet Graham on 07843 380401

conditions.weatherComment:
12mm on Friday.  3mm Mon. 10mm Tues. 17mm Weds. 
Overnight frost -1.4. 
0.5mm rain yesterday afternoon. 
Dry and bright today. +5 tomorrow. Ground frost free and racing.
conditions.other:
Please remember photo ID and face coverings. 
Please familiarise yourselves with BHA resumption of racing plan.
Temporary male changing room on 1st/2nd floors of main building.
Female Jockeys in Weighing Room building.
Colour drop off/collection at entrance of temporary facility.
Taunton is in a Tier 4 Region

Chase bends at innermost and 3 yards from innermost and Hurdle bends 8 and 16 yards from innermost positions, effect on distances:
All Hurdle races and Bumper adds approx 120 yards
Race 3 adds approx 27 yards
Race 6 adds approx 18 yards
conditions.weatherComment:
12mm on Friday.  3mm Mon. 10mm Tues. 17mm yesterday/overnight. 
Mainly drier, cooler Thurs/Fri. Showers possibly wintry at times Fri p.m/Saturday. Chance of light overnight frost.
conditions.other:
Please remember photo ID and face coverings. 
Please familiarise yourselves with BHA resumption of racing plan.
Temporary male changing room on 1st/2nd floors of main building.
Female Jockeys in Weighing Room building.
Colour drop off/collection at entrance of temporary facility.
Taunton is in a Tier 4 Region
conditions.stablingComment:
No overnight stabling or accommodation.
Complimentary tea, coffee, water along with a hot meal for Stable
Staff in the Lorry Park
conditions.bookingComment:
Green Zone Parking (Trainers/Jockeys/Valets/Raceday Staff) -
Northernmost entrance from the B3170 (first entrance you encounter from Taunton), before the first race. signposted ‘green zone’ where you will be directed to park in the centre of the course, open 5 hours before the first trace.

conditions.rails: The Running rail on the Chase Course is positioned between 7 and 8yds out around each bend. The rail on the Hurdle Course is positioned approx 7yds out around Padddock bend and approx 4yds out around the rest of the course
conditions.weatherComment: Dry since Wednesday to Midday Saturday. Temp down to -2c on Saturday morning, grass frost but no frost in ground at 6.30am. 10mm rain recorded through Wednesday. 2mm rain Tuesday. Saturday is forecast to be largely dry and cold. Frost covers are down on take offs and landings.  For live weather station and Going info please use link: www.ascot.co.uk/thegoing
conditions.other: The stable staff canteen will be serving complimentary food to all stable staff. A packed lunch will be provided to attendees who are working.

Next week rain/showers are due from Monday evening through to Thursday morning (16 to 20mm) predicted at this stage. conditions.groundComment: Having got this close to first race time we are giving the course every chance to enable racing to go ahead and will update accordingly.
conditions.rails:
Shared bend for top bend. Bottom bends remain split. 
Hurdle top bend out 7 yards and bottom bend out 13 yards from inner most line.  
Chase top bend out 17 yards and bottom bend out 3 yards from inner most line.
conditions.weatherComment: 4mm of rain yesterday. Overnight low of -2C, dipping to -3C as the sunrises, temperature slowly starting to rise and due to get to a max temp of 5C with bright sunshine.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before first race, NO access allowed until passing through this and please remember your I.D and a face mask. Due to National Lockdown we regret Owners are not permitted. There is NO overnight stabling or accommodation available, lunch bags will be provided to all stable staff FOC, these will be available in the stable canteen, staff showers will be out of use for this meeting.
conditions.inspectionComment: Currently still some frost in the ground, slowly thawing out in the bright winter sunshine, Temp is currently +2C and due to rise to +3C by midday. With this in mind we feel the need to have another look but are hopeful with the forecast. Update at 12.35pm current temp +3C and giving it every chance to improve for racing.
conditions.lowSunProvision: Low sun could result in obstacle omission at this fixture

conditions.inspectionComment: Temperature -2C upon arrival at 6am, dipping to -3C with daylight, early signs are promising but I want to see temps in the positive before making a firm decision. data.weatherText: 4mm of rain yesterday. Overnight low of -2C, dipping to -3C as the sunrises, temperature slowly starting to rise and due to get to a max temp of 5C with bright sunshine.
data.goingText: Soft, Heavy (in places) Having got this close to first race time we are giving the course every chance to enable racing to go ahead and will update accordingly. (GoingStick:5.8 on 23-01-2021 at 07:30) Going stick update to follow.
data.inspectionsText: (Status: Pending) (Status: Pending) (Status: Pending) Inspection to be held on Monday 25-01-2021 at 12:00 Currently still some frost in the ground, slowly thawing out in the bright winter sunshine, Temp is currently +2C and due to rise to +3C by midday. With this in mind we feel the need to have another look but are hopeful with the forecast. Inspection to be held on Monday 25-01-2021 at 10:00 Temperature -2C upon arrival at 6am, dipping to -3C with daylight, early signs are promising but I want to see temps in the positive before making a firm decision. The forecast is favourable with bright sunshine later, but temps are set to rise slowly this morning to a forecast best max of +5C With everything in mind, a second inspection will be held at 10am to check conditions. Inspection to be held on Monday 25-01-2021 at 08:00 A second inspection will be needed at 10am to check conditions.

data.cotcInspectionText: Snow clearance has gone well today although we still have some remnants in the track.  Following Sunday night’s low of -10c, the temperature is forecast to drop as low as -5c overnight, with a slow thaw expected tomorrow prior to some light rain later in the day with a high of +4c.  As such the decision has been taken to hold a precautionary inspection at 9:00 a.m. tomorrow, although we remain confident.

data.other: Green Zone Screening Stations remain Gate B (Horseboxes) and Gate C (Trainers and Jockeys). Horseboxes will be asked to hold momentarily while horses are using the horsewalk. Behind Closed Doors Seated rooms upstairs will be made available in Kingwell Lodge for canteen feeding.

data.going: ABANDONED - Waterlogged (Day of Racing)
data.weather: 40mm rain last week. Dry on Friday. -2C overnight into Saturday. Dry & cold on Saturday. -3C overnight into Sunday. Overcast & cold all day on Sunday with a top temp of 0C. -3C overnight into Monday. Monday was dry and bright with a top temp of +5C, but with a wind chill. Dry and -1.5C overnight into Tuesday. Temperatures rose during Tuesday and we had an overnight low of +2C into Wednesday. Currently +6C and overcast which is forecast to remain all day. 15mm rain overnight. further 4-5mm forecast between now and noon, track waterlogged.
data.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)
